title: Strictly’s Dianne Buswell leaves viewers heartbroken as she breaks down in tears after elimination
text:
Dianne was clearly heartbroken as she clung on to Dev (Picture: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing viewers were heartbroken as a gutted Dianne Buswell broke down in the middle of the dance floor after being eliminated with Dev Griffin.

The pro dancer clung on to her radio DJ dance partner after they were unanimously voted to leave the competition after facing off against Viscountess Emma Weymouth and Aljaz Skorjanec in the dance-off.

The couple had performed a Cha Cha to Dancing With A Stranger by Sam Smith, landing in the lower middle of the leaderboard.

But it was the lack of votes at the public that sealed their fate in the dance-off, before the judges dealt the final blow.

‘Dev has been absolutely amazing. His work ethic is insane. I see him everywhere practising and I couldn’t have asked for a better partner,’ she told Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Thank you so much for all your time and your effort. This boy has so much talent, I’m really sad he won’t be able to show you guys any more of it.’

Holding it together as they said their goodbyes, it wasn’t until the final dance that Dianne broke down in tears, openly weeping as the song When You’re Gone by Mel C and Bryan Adams played in the background.

On top of viewers threatening to boycott the show in light of the shocking early exit for ‘Team Red Devils’, fans over the country couldn’t help but feel for Dianne, whose emotions were put on full display after an intense showdown.

Basically, the whole nation wanted to give her a massive hug.

broke my heart to see Dianne crying 😩😩😩Why @bbcstrictly why?!? A potential finalist gone making you look like utter idiots. #strictly #StrictlyComeDancing pic.twitter.com/LaJeZaytCm — Poppy Grace (@_poppygrace) October 13, 2019

Oh my heart! Poor poor Dianne being filmed sobbing her heart out😭 #Strictly — Lydia♡ (@Lydia_Rose2212) October 13, 2019

Omg Dianne sobbing just broke my heart #Strictly — Chloe💕 (@ChloeBurr_) October 13, 2019

I have to say watching poor Dianne struggling to keep it together is hurting my heart. #strictly — Beccy (@beccytweets) October 13, 2019

Aww dianne's crying, the nations in tears😭😭😭 will always love you both @dbuzz6589 @dev_101 and we'll never forget ur amazing Aladdin routine❤❤🤧 #strictly — aqua.m7 (@m7_aqua) October 13, 2019

Dev and Dianne’s exit came despite Chris Ramsey, Will Bayley and Alex Jones all scoring lower than they did during the main show.

Advertisement

Advertisement

All four judges – Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse, Shirley Ballas and Bruno Tonioli – came under fire online during Saturday’s performance for their ‘seriously odd’ scores.

More: Strictly Come Dancing Strictly's Dianne Buswell posts emotional message to Dev Griffin after shock exit Furious Strictly viewers claim phones were jammed for Dev and Dianne Strictly threaten to boycott show after controversial Dev and Dianne exit

David James, who had been in the bottom two for the first two weeks, found himself jumping up the leaderboard after impressing with Nadiya Bychkova.

Strictly Come Dancing continues on Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One and BBC iPlayer.
